summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between federal prosecutors and an attorney, discussing investigative leads in the SDNY's Epstein investigation. It includes a subpoena result for Ghislaine Maxwell's Instagram account, planning for witness interviews in Florida and California, and an attorney proffer detailing a victim's account of Epstein's operations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The target of a subpoena for her Instagram account; described in a proffer as the 'original girl finder' for Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pop
persons.context: Attorney who submitted a detailed attorney proffer on behalf of his client, a victim of Epstein, to the SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; his arrest, pattern of operation involving introducing girls, and interactions with associates are discussed.

connections.description: Maxwell is described in a victim's proffer as the 'original girl finder' for Epstein, indicating a central role in his operation.
Pop is the attorney for a client who is a victim of Epstein, providing a proffer to prosecutors about her involvement.
The victim's proffer indicates Maxwell was involved in finding girls for Epstein, placing her in a perpetrator role relative to victims.

events.title: Last login to Maxwell's Instagram
events.description: The last recorded login to Ghislaine Maxwell's Instagram account occurred in August 2019 from an IP address in Vermont.

events.title: Maxwell Instagram account creation
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's Instagram account was created in May 2014, with a registration IP address in New York City.

events.title: Submission of Attorney Proffer
events.description: Attorney Jeffrey S. Pop submitted a detailed attorney proffer to SDNY prosecutors regarding his client's experiences with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutor's Assurance to Attorney
events.description: An AUSA communicated to attorney Jeff Pop that, based on initial information, his client did not currently have criminal exposure related to her interactions with Epstein.

keyFacts: Investigators subpoenaed and confirmed Ghislaine Maxwell's Instagram account, with the last login in August 2019 from Vermont and account creation in New York City in 2014.
An attorney proffer from Jeffrey S. Pop contained a victim's claim that Epstein told her 'Maxwell was the "original girl finder"'.
Prosecutors were planning in-person interviews with witnesses in Florida and California, indicating active witness development in early 2020.
The proffer described a pattern of Epstein using multiple people to introduce girls to him, a scheme alleged to have lasted for decades.
Prosecutors had preliminarily assessed that the victim represented by Attorney Pop did not have criminal exposure based on her described interactions with Epstein.
